website_summaries.verdict: Ring didn't do anything particularly innovative with its Alarm Security Kit, but this inexpensive DIY system stands out because of its simplicity.
pros: The $199 Ring Alarm Security Kit is quick to install, its app is easy to use and the system itself is simple to manage
The price is excellent and you can add extra accessories a la carte as needed
cons: Ring's home security system doesn't currently work with Alexa, despite being an Amazon brand -- or any other major smart home platforms

customer_reviews.title: Product is Great. Customer Service is Even Better.
customer_reviews.text: I had some issues with Sensors initially. Ring stood behind their product so much so that they called me after a negative review and showed up at my house to install the system and work through all the issues. I have NEVER and I repeat NEVER seen such excellent customer service in my life. System is working great and at a fraction of the cost of other systems. I highly recommend Ring. And what they stand for as a company - they will stand by their products at all costs. They want to disrupt the market and they will. Thank you Ring.
customer_reviews.author: edwardprince

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT! LOVE RING ALARM
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE RING ALARM!!! It has been working great! Took me a little bit to get used to turning it off before opening my doors but I love that you can arm or disarm it through the app on my phone!!! I ordered the professional monitoring from them too for $100 for an entire year! Just a great deal all the way around!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wateringcan7

customer_reviews.title: Consumer friendly system, great buy.
customer_reviews.text: The product is great for the price. Wish the mounting brackets had "up" written on it. The screws are also cheap. Those are minor issues. Glad someone figured out IOT for security systems. There is no longer a reason to spend $30 a month for cellular back up.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn P Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry, I had high expectations. Here are my two issues. 1) Cellular connection for the base is only 1 bar and is based on AT&T reception in my area. No fix! 2) Motion detectors are useless with a dog over 40 lbs. The dog will constantly set them off when we aren't home. I don't want a system without motion, so this is a deal breaker. I will be returning unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: J&B Thibs

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Value
customer_reviews.text: Wow - this system was incredibly easy to set up and operate. I'm impressed by the amount of customization too. Plus, knowing I can get profession monitoring for just $10/ month is icing on the cake. I ordered extra motion sensors and they integrated perfectly. Highly encourage anyone looking for a security system to try Ring.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Ring alarm system
customer_reviews.text: Recently got this alarm system for my home in Canada ! Simple to install. Easy to use . Simply the best DIY system . Got extra contact sensors for all my windows and doors . I highly recommend it ! . Kudos to Ring for a great system .
customer_reviews.author: Mike Clement

customer_reviews.title: Bye Bye ADT...
customer_reviews.text: Seriously easy, Amazingly affordable, ADT will feel the pain soon. Actually, if anyone gives this product a negative review it's alarm companies that rely on residual income from exorbitant monthly equipment & service fees. In about two hours, you should be up & running!! This system is 100% customizable for commercial and residential use. The only wire component is the Base Station which connects to the Internet and houses the audible alarm... 😎👍 This is an investment that pays dividends immediately!
customer_reviews.author: G.P.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for six months...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Ring kit exactly six months ago. Installation was easy and everything worked as it should including integration with Alexa! Now the base station will not connect to my network and can't see any of the devices that are installed. It started to tell me it could only connect by cell and then lost the Wi-Fi as well. Now the app won't even talk to the thing. The base station is the only thing that can't be purchased separately - the only way to buy a new one is to purchase a whole new kit!
customer_reviews.author: D. C.

customer_reviews.title: Updated review - Second Unit
customer_reviews.text: So after the defective unit I initially received was replaced, everything worked exactly as expected. I had zero issues connecting devices and so far everything looks to be functional. The Ring support personnel that reached out after my initial difficulties was excellent and went above and beyond to ensure I was able to have a good experience with the product.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away!!!
customer_reviews.text: Stay away from it. The hardware is cheaply made in China. I bought the 5 piece alarm set and 2 more door sensors and 3 mor motion sensors for a total of 10 pieces. Out of that 4 don’t work. That’s 40% bad. There support is so bad I can’t describe it. Is is almost impossible to find anything on their website other than the things they want to sell you. To bad it is so bad they had a nice idea to bad the product is so bad!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Roger C.

customer_reviews.title: It works but not compatible with most wireless sensors
customer_reviews.text: You need to use their overpriced sensors can't use other companies or commonly used sensors. Their sensors are hugely overpriced and the "starter" kit would not adequately protect a house... You might be able to use this for an apartment on the second story or one with limited entry points/windows but the kit is pretty much worthless without another $500-$1000 in sensors if you want complete coverage of a house anyways... The sensors are also huge for some reason...
customer_reviews.author: Kianta W. Asplund

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!!
customer_reviews.text: My security system is up and running perfectly. The tech/customer service was superb, very knowledgeable about the products and helped me trouble-shoot some minor issues I had within a minute. This is one of those companies who stands behind their products and really makes efforts to improve their products. I initially purchased a ring door bell, which I liked very much, and now my whole house has ring security system with two flood light cameras that are being installed. I will buy additional cameras around my house and will be sure to sign up for protect plus which is a bargain price in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install. Pathetic Siren.
customer_reviews.text: Overall the system is amazing. Super easy to put together. They really dialed that part in. It all works beautifully. But the alarm siren volume is the achille's heel of the whole thing. Its just not very loud. And the Domes, the only add-on siren modules that you can buy for the system are even worse. They are certainly not going to "shock & awe" a would-be burglar. At the most it will let them know that their presence has been detected... as long as they are not using any power tools - then they probably won't hear it at all. If Amazon could fix the siren volume issue, the package would be an easy 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Bachi

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Before mounting it all and turning the alarm on, I positioned all the sensors in the general vicinity of where they would be permanently mounted and ran the alarm un-armed. I did this to make sure the sensors would not lose connectivity and would not indicate a false alarm. They did not. It is now armed and works well. I bought this kit, along with extenders and extra sensors (door/window and IR). They all integrated nicely except one that refuses to pair. All in all, this is a very good system for the price.
customer_reviews.author: RemcoW

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Bad Monitoring Service. I indicated that I am going to leave the country for 10 days the same as my contact. This is so that if the alarm sounds quickly send to the police. They told me that it is not possible. So we are giving away our money to you. I will write this on all social networks and I will search for other security companies.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Ring fails to integrate their own cameras into their own security system so they work in unison
customer_reviews.text: The Ring ecosystem of security system and cameras has a major flaw. Should one have the ability to have cameras arm when security system is armed and disarm when security system is disarmed? They don’t. How is it that this simple function doesn’t integrate with the cameras and security system. Ring’s sad solution is that cameras can work on a daily schedule that you need to set. Our lives are more variable that M-F 8-5 type of timing. I just want interior cameras to record when we set our alarm and we are away. Tech support acknowledges this and doesn’t have a solution anytime soon. Simplisafe’s newest system may be the better solution.
customer_reviews.author: ggodzilla

customer_reviews.title: No luck.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a family member to monitor water in basement. Install was very difficult as there was no feedback, but then items eventually connected. Within a few hours 3 of the five sensors went offline, never to return, apparently. A fourth, the water sensor in the basement, repeatedly goes offline and then reports low battery, then periodically reconnects. No help on the internet, other then to factory reset everything. So with the glowing reviews I must have the only problem. Could be. Will return and move on.
customer_reviews.author: E. J.

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I returned this entire security system! The motion sensors would not link up to the wi-fi, even after I went to my internet provider and exchanged the modem for a faster one. As a result I did not attach the sensors to the doors, because the double sided sticky tape would rip the paint off if I had to remove it. Very disappointed as I have both of the Ring doorbells (the original and the "2").
customer_reviews.author: Lisette Fimian

customer_reviews.title: Works well and for a fraction of the competitors cost
customer_reviews.text: I really like this home security system. No contracts, $10/month for full 24/7 security and cell backup. Everything works flawlessly. The home station alarm is very loud and scary. I had a free one year ring account when I bought their doorbell and that service covers the $10/month so right now I get the professional add on for free. So glad I don’t have to deal with other companies like brinks and adt who charge over triple the price and require 3 year contracts and pushy sales person and require a stranger to come to your house and install the system. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Erhan Ozbay

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup, configure and use. Adding additional door sensors was a breeze Love being able to arm/disarm using the IOS App when you've forgotten to do so via the keypad. Its great having one app for both the ring doorbell camera and the security system. With summer in full swing its nice to know when the doors been left open via an audible cue and app notification when the kids go out and play
customer_reviews.author: Ehsan

customer_reviews.title: Devices would not connect to base station. Fustrating.
customer_reviews.text: Only the motion detector ever connected with the base station, after an hour., I just left the red spinning connection icon on and walked away frustrated, it connected sometime within an hour. None of the other provided devices would connect. I have used Ring tech support before and I just don’t have hours to go through all the troubleshooting. I see too much wasted time and trouble to get it right. I do use 3 ring cameras. I have packed this up to send back. Now Ring is notifying me every 5 minutes that my station is down. This means a time consuming call to get this shut down. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mark Francis

customer_reviews.title: Ring Alarm 5 Piece Kit – Home Security System
customer_reviews.text: I just wonted to let everyone know how easy this is to setup and use. i also include some pics on how i made a garage door switch that works perfectly every time. only cost about three bucks for the hing. got them at lowes. the system works just great, just need to get used to using it with all the family members. not going to get the monitoring yet until everyone is used to it. i hope the pictures help to save you money on switches.
customer_reviews.author: kjp41

customer_reviews.title: Alarm Motion detector false alarmed
customer_reviews.text: One of the two motion detectors I installed false alarmed (still in practice mode) a few days after installation. It was adjacent to another brand motion detector that appeared more sensitive and did not false alarm. A motion sensor has been in the spot for about 20 years with no prior false alarms. When I called Ring they suggested a bug in front of the sensor and lowered the sensitivity. Although everything else in the system worked fine and the monitoring is very well priced; I decided it wasn't worth the risk of a false alarm that would cause the police to be called so I returned it and kept using my prior system.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: What's going on? This is junk!
customer_reviews.text: 9 out of 10 times the motion detectors would not trigger the alarm. I bought 5 motion detectors and I tried of 3 of them. They did not work. Pure garbage. I waited 3 to 4 minutes after activation in another room. Then I would walk less than two feet from the sensor and alarm would NOT trigger. Setting was on automatic rapid no delay alarm sound. I spoke to two specialists over the phone two separate times. Both had me jumping thru hoops doing tedious steps over and over. Until I got tired because we weren't going anywhere. I bought many separate pieces and all this garbage is going back!
customer_reviews.author: Tundra has bad small overlap

customer_reviews.title: Simple and most cost-effective security system on the market
customer_reviews.text: Installation of this security system is a breeze as the Ring app give step-by-step instructions and videos. We currently have 5 contact and 2 motion sensors with plans to add several more contact sensors for complete coverage. The motion sensors do not register our 38-pound lab on the middle sensitivity setting, which is nice. We use several other Ring products and have never been disappointed. Their customer service is top-notch as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Paying for monitoring yet can’t set up. Not for Business.
customer_reviews.text: I’m paying for monitoring but I’m unable to register my alarm because I can’t verify my address. I have an address. I do not know what the problem is. I tried to get help, but I’m unable to chat with a Ring representative. I want to add one more important thing for this review. In one of the reviews a person with a small business was able to get monitoring for their ring alarm. I’m paying for monitoring but Ring is unable to set up monitoring because they said it’s a business. I’ve already installed everything and payed to notify the police. This is totally ridiculous!!!!
customer_reviews.author: BigD

customer_reviews.title: Nothing in particular
customer_reviews.text: This system looks great on my wall and is a great theft deterrent for a potential thief, but my biggest issue is getting it to connect to the internet! I've tried numerous times to make it work but it keeps saying "Can't connect to the internet" I'm about to trash the system but I dished out some serious cash for this! I added a range extender to my WiFi network hoping that would help, but still nothing! So as for now all I have is a system with colored lights displaying on my wall!
customer_reviews.author: SARGE

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work--scam
customer_reviews.text: My sensors wouldn't work just one room away from the base station. One wall--25 feet--separating them! Far less than the 250 feet advertised, and I used the range extender. I know the sensors worked because they worked fine near the station, but when moving a bit away they failed.
customer_reviews.author: CA

customer_reviews.title: The Worst: 20 minutes and can't find wouter
customer_reviews.text: It was a 40 minute installation attempt 10 minutes to sign up and give all my personal information away 20 minutes trying to sync router with iPhone, both feet from the modem router 10 minutes to re-pack and return Now Ring has all my information, and I never even used it. STAY AWAY !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike90125

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Awesome Customer Servcie!
customer_reviews.text: Updating my review to 5 stars! The Ring team reached out to me and answered any questions/concerns I had about the professional monitoring. I was also given contact information if I had any more concerns. I now understand how it works and I know they are receiving my alerts because I got a call last night when my alarm went off. The setup was easy and it’s very user friendly. I opted for the $100 a year monitoring which is a great deal. I also have the Ring door bell and I just ordered the floodlights. Ring all the way!
customer_reviews.author: Naeest86

customer_reviews.title: For the money, this is the best product on the market.
customer_reviews.text: 1. The support is 24/7 and its excellent for basic issues. (But it is not so good for advanced technical problems.) 2. The power and cellular back-up is very good. 3. The alerts are very fast as well. 4. Exceptionally reliable. 5. The video quality is very good and exceptional in low light. 6. The audio quality is exceptional as well. The limitations: 1. the extender range is weak for a medium to large house (this causes problems with security) 2. needs custom alert sounds based on what happens per device 3. needs facial recognition like nest 4. needs to stop cutting off/on by design; it should provide continuous recording when motion is active.
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: No integrations.
customer_reviews.text: Two stars for the lack of integrations. Ecobee thermostat is an amazon company and so is Ring. I have been years to change the ecobee thermostat if the ring alarm is armed disarmed but it haven’t happened yet. At bare minimum support integrations with Ecobee, IFTTT and SmartThings. This is 2020 already! Very few updates are released for this device which could mean that Amazon is not putting too much investment towards this.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Yoda

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation - somewhat basic functionality
customer_reviews.text: The install is super easy and in typical Ring fashion, the instructions are great. Customization of the system is somewhat basic and there’s no geofencing atm, but I anticipate Ring building in the functionality to make this system awesome. Plus...you cannot best the monitoring fee especially if you have Ring cameras/doorbell
customer_reviews.author: Jason M

customer_reviews.title: Be aware of your city permit fee of $125/year !!!!
customer_reviews.text: It didn't tell you until you open the box and installed, there is permit fee you have to obtain your own for $125/year. So it's not $10/month, it's double ! Also the base station report Cell signal low while my cell phone has full LTE bar, first night after installed and base station was offline without reason. Have to unplug the power and reconnect with cell phone app. I already start feeling the pain !
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: The worst customer help ever.
customer_reviews.text: My experience with the Ring costumer help was So bad that I am considering going back to my old security System provider who is willing to give me $15 ah month deal . I felt as if the person was using me as a Guinea pig . And not interested in keeping me the costumer happy. It was so terrible because I was ranting to my friends how wonderful the ring System was until today costumer supposed to be help .
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Works for you, not a security company!
customer_reviews.text: We spent a significant amount of time looking into Security Systems before we made our purchase, and by far the Ring System was the best. Installation was a breeze, and there is virtually zero maintenance on anything (we have had ours for over 6months and the rechargeable battery on the keypad hasn’t even needed to be charged yet!). Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a security system that is extremely easy to install, and works for you, not for a security company! It also integrates flawlessly with other ring devices, such as doorbells and security cameras. Love that we can see everything in an easy to use app!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Ring products suck
customer_reviews.text: We have the highest speed internet. All of our other electronics in our house have no issue with our internet. But ALL of our ring devices lose connection ALL the time. We literally have to go outside and reconnect everything at least twice a week. We spent so much money on all these products for no reason.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: Works great and was easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I took my time and made sure that I went step by step during the installation. If you follow the instructions and follow the steps it works great. I believe that it took about one hour. I have had it for about one month and I have not had any problems. It seems that RING has thought of everything, including the one week trial to make mistakes before going live. And the amount of money that I'm saving for the monitoring makes this system worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Christopheram

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price, good product
customer_reviews.text: I set up my ring alarm by myself, All cable inside wall, Very good alarm very good price $100 dollars a year you are cover I also got a door sensor in the garage so every nite is armed, if someone opens trigger alarm
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo montes

customer_reviews.title: This system is a disaster
customer_reviews.text: What a huge disappointment after spending over 4 hours setting up the system and trying to get help from support. The base station keeps disconnected, the motion sensor could not be properly added, and the camera (separate) can't even be setup to record ONLY when you are away. This system and its designers are clueless. No wonder why they have only a average or lower rating.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Carignan

customer_reviews.title: I say go for it!
customer_reviews.text: The starter kit is a little light on peripheral equipment, but I can see how it helps to get the price so low. I’m completely satisfied with the product and monitoring service. A 10% discount on all future Ring product purchases will be applied once you opt in to the monitoring service. This also gets you a lifetime warranty on all Ring devices. That makes it well worth the fee. The only caveat is that the new stuff has to be purchased through the Ring website. The discount does NOT carryover to Amazon. This confuses me and hope this will surely change in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: PrydeWater

customer_reviews.title: Worst post sales support
customer_reviews.text: Ring has the worst technical support, I already email, chat, and called more than 40 times and they can't remove or edit the Neighborhood, and from the app it's not possible, they simply don't care about clients. I recommend to buy Yi cameras, much cheaper, Ring doesn't care about clients.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro

customer_reviews.title: Great alarm system!!!
customer_reviews.text: This system was a HUGE upgrade from our older 2nd gen simplisafe system. Since buying it I've convinced two other people to go with this system. Alexa smart integration works great. nothing like being about to fall asleep remembering you didn't turn on the alarm and being able to shout out "Alexa set ring to stay." system has Wired LAN, wireless, and cellular features. All systems are reliable. When the internet drops out it switches to cellular seamlessly and sends you an alert. App is incredibly fast to respond. Best of all the price is very affordable.
customer_reviews.author: cory

customer_reviews.title: Received false alarms
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Danielle H. from Ring promptly contacted me afterwards and was more than helpful in resolving the issue. She suggested from possible solutions and even offered to have me reimbursed if I had been fined and replace the motion detector that detected the false alarm. Very satisfied with the prompt customer service from Danielle H. Alarm was set while on vacation with no animals or anyone inside the house and motion detector went off. Blinds were all closed. Came back to find the sensor was on the wall untouched. False alarm which would’ve gotten me fined by local police.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Ochoa

customer_reviews.title: 8 PC Bundle was the Best Deal to Me
customer_reviews.text: Had been want the ring alarm system for our new house because of the value, integration with Alexa, the video doorbell with monitored surveillance for $100 dollars a year you can't beat it. Saw one at Costco on sale for a 10pc but was with one motion detector, base station, extender, siren and 6 door alarms @$189.99. With 3 doors I'd rather have the 3 door alarms and 2 motion detectors since I'm covering 2500 sqft and it came with the echo which is a plus as well. Best deal by far and happy with my purchase 🏆👍🥇👍🏆 Update I added a kwikset z wave smart lock and intergrates perfectly. Pic attached
customer_reviews.author: Steven B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: System set up is fairly straight forward. After installing and activating 8 separate components following the step-by-step instructions, the 9th component (a window sensor) showed an error message ("Serious Configuration Error") after repeated attempts to activate it. I contacted Ring customer service and was instructed to simply follow the installation procedure again. They closed the trouble ticket twice without resolving my problem. Then Danielle H. from the Ring office in Southeastern Pennsylvania got involved. She ensured the replacement was sent and, in an amazing effort to ensure my satisfaction, actually delivered a replacement in person! Sure the office was nearby but still is "above and beyond." Thanks Danielle from a very satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Ray D

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: Updated review after having this for a few months: PROS - Easy install - Flexibility with type and amount of devices - Option in/out of monitoring services - Connected smoke alarm/co2 via bluetooth (huge plus for me) CONS - App doesn't always work - System sometimes disconnects - Biggest con: cameras are jokingly expensive. Not even worth buying In conclusion: its alright for door and motion sensor monitoring. If you want cameras, get the Wyze ones instead! Better app, better support, literally 1/5 of the price for same camera functionality
customer_reviews.author: Sploder

customer_reviews.title: Defective x 2
customer_reviews.text: First base station was defective; Customer support was great but couldn't resolve issue so had to initiate a return. Replacement provided next day, but took over an hour to set up due to repeated set up failure messages. Once set up, unit kept dropping connection to wifi and mobile app; Unable to set up components. Sent back same day for refund. Done with Ring.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Value
customer_reviews.text: The RA system is a quality product with easy homeowner installation. I didn't follow proper door sensor installation which caused a fault that I couldn't resolve. Called the helpline and quickly had a tech (David) on the line who was friendly, courteous, and knowledgeable he had me do a hard reset which cleared the fault. Our home has sunspaces, during the summer we leave the outer doors open for ventilation. RA allows us to bypass the door sensors with the push of a button. Although Ring Alarm is a new product the company has a reputation for high-quality innovative products.
customer_reviews.author: G. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Motion detection did not pair.  Tried for over 1/2 hour and it did not work.
customer_reviews.text: The motion dection sensor did not work/pair. We ordered a second one and it did pair, but the first one did not pair and we tried everything. We even changed the batteries, but the first motion detector still did not work (we tried to get this thing to work for over 1/2 an hour). The 2nd working motion detector did work/paird with the base station but did not have good motion detection. We had to adjust the height down to 6 feet before it even caught anything.
customer_reviews.author: W.S.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I am super disappointed with this system. The notifications a just a little “ding” on your phone even when The alarm is sounding, which is not all the that loud in the house, neighbors certainly can’t hear it my 2 year old slept through it on numerous occasions,No flashing screen, no vibration, you can’t even change the tone to something specific so you know that it is your alarm. My motion detector doesn’t work consistently. And customer support is THE WORST!! Not sure if it’s even a person or a robot. They don’t have answers and then they just disconnect the chat.
customer_reviews.author: Drea N.

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but they are not ready, do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Replaced 3 different Adt systems with ring alarms in 3 different location. Saving over for the monthly Adt service was amazing. However I am regretting the decision now. Sensors keep imagining stuff, ring monitoring calling me at 3am. Keypads going offline very frequently triggering alarms during entrance. Talked with customer support multiple times about the sensors going offline but I am done. Great idea but they are not ready, do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Oz

customer_reviews.title: Not a security device
customer_reviews.text: A power outage (around 24 hours) will disable the devices and require all of them to be added again. The door sensor devices malfunction for high use doorways as well. This is not a good choice for home security.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Cutlet

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't work
customer_reviews.text: Spent an hour trying to get this set up. Some components would never connect. Spent some time on the phone with customer service. They couldn't get the sensors to connect either. Now I'm returning the kit. Sadly my wall is worse for wear because I used the sticker to mount the motion sensor before finding out the other components weren't going to work. It was a frustrating 2 hour diversion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Monitoring company has never contacted me when tripped
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this system for maybe just over a month. In this time I have had my daughter set it off three times when leaving the house. Not Once have I been contacted by ring or anything. Makes me question why I spent the money to feel protected when my alarm is tripped and I hear nothing from my monitoring company. Not feeling very confident in their services. May be returning this system for one I feel protected by in case of an intruder.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Daly

customer_reviews.title: limited use, very liited
customer_reviews.text: If you want a security system do not buy it, Amazon will not allow me to tell you the TRUTH about this item, however it is just garbage. Go to only one phone, and the wrong one at that, cannot call them after the first time or you have to pay. DO NOT BUY IT.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R.

customer_reviews.title: nice if it would work
customer_reviews.text: Made the mistake and bought one for the office and one for the house. Office worked, then went to install in the house, crap system wouldn't find the phone 3 feet away. don't know if can only do one base station, but will not talk to each other. without the system talking to the phone, it is worthless. I hate when the try to make them so simple that they don't work. when the devices will not communicate, there is no way to work around. Will not buy another system. look for something that works.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Good, but needs more features
customer_reviews.text: I like that it works with Alexa, but still needs some Alexa features added. I also have 2 Schlage WiFi locks that work with Ring, but the locks can be configured for 4, 6, or 8 digit code, while Ring app will only allow 4 digit code to be pushed to the lock. This causes the lock to revert to the 4 digit configuration, disabling any 6 or 8 digit codes previously added. It would also be nice if I could snooze the door and window sensors like I can with motion detectors and cameras.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy Ring Alarm System or Cameras Defective Fail Constantly Going Offline
customer_reviews.text: Spent a lot of money on Ring Alarm and Security Equipment and on professional installation and worst purchase I have ever made. Should have gone with a hardwire alarm and security system instead. Constantly goes offline and have to reset main module on ceiling. Biggest regret in purchasing this terrible equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Bernardo J. Escobar

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get any easier!
customer_reviews.text: This system is great! I purchased another system a few years ago and installed it myself. It wasn't easy and the batteries went dead constantly! That system had no app, wasn't modern looking (the sensors had little antennae), and it cost more than this one! I don't think Ring could have made a better product. It literally took minutes to install and add additional sensors. Turning it on and off is a breeze with the app! Forgot to turn it on with the keypad and already in bed? No problem, use your phone! I plan to add at least one floodlight camera and I'm sure that will be a breeze as well. This is exactly what we needed!
customer_reviews.author: Mischelle Philpot

customer_reviews.title: No audible alarm on iPhone/system is wonky
customer_reviews.text: The app will not sound an alarm on an iPhone which makes it essentially worthless. You must sign for a $100/year to get a phone call to let you know the alarm has been activated. Useless! Update 10/24/19: system is too wonky. Keypad stopped working again and this time it will not reset. I upgraded it to two stars, but still can not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris in CT

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: I love this ring alarm. I also purchased the floodlight cam and doorbell. The alarm works with Alexa very nicely. Very easy to install. Getting ahold of their customer support though requires a phone call as they don't answer emails and their online chat doesn't work. I would buy this again and do highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jodiesel

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: We have yet to get signed up for monitoring, but knowing that the siren from the base unit will blare (loud enough to scare off intruder, not loud enough to alert neighbors) and send my phone a push notification is comforting. Certainly an element of peace of mind. Very easy to setup. Motion sensor can be a little weird: app will say motion detected when clearly no motion currently can be picked up, but it doesn't affect triggering alarm, it's more like a vestigial message. Only thing I wish ring offered was cheap glass break sensors
customer_reviews.author: Jared Wilson

customer_reviews.title: No problems here...
customer_reviews.text: Works great with alexa and through the ring app. I've had a few connection problems with the door sensors when first installed, but nothing ring customer service weren't able to solve. Although, I've only called ring customer service a handful of times. They were pretty good and helpful. Add to this, the $100 a year I spend for cloud service and ring protection includes alarm monitoring too. Great service with a bargain. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Joey B.

customer_reviews.title: Please work on getting these systems to work seemlessly. May give it another try at a later day.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the five piece set plus additional contacts. Returned because could not get some of the window/door contacts to work. Very disappointed as I was really looking forward to finally having a security system that and monitoring that was reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Beware of weak login security!
customer_reviews.text: Most services have ways of protecting you if someone obtains your password. NOT RING! The entire response to the recent news accounts of cameras being hacked are to use stronger passwords. This is a weak response, and they are avoiding responsibility for their part in this. RING: Can you please implement BASIC security precautions that most other services already provide? 1. Notify me when there’s a login from a new device or browser? 2. Detect when the number of failed logins exceeds a certain threshold and lock the account? 3. Support 2 factor authentication via email as well as phone? When I’m traveling abroad I sometimes don’t have access to my SMS.
customer_reviews.author: David Ahlers

customer_reviews.title: Ring can't find it's own keypad. How will it protect your home?
customer_reviews.text: After 4 hours trying to connect everything, my conclusion is the Ring Alarm is still in its early developement stage. Do not buy this. The keypad will not connect. Tech support was someone reading from a troubleshooting list and had no clue what was wrong. After 30min. tech support gave up and wanted to ship me a new keypad which will take 4 to 6 days shipping and required my credit card in case I don't return their precious defective keypad. Also both of my First Alert smoke & co2 detectors will not connect. Returned everything. What a painful experience.
customer_reviews.author: MNK

customer_reviews.title: Ease of set up.  Great monitoring cost
customer_reviews.text: Set up the entire system during tv commercials over about a hour and a half. One dead door sensor that wouldn’t connect, but otherwise painless. A Little creativity is needed in an old house, but the magnets work in or out of the rather large mounts. Seamless connection to all four echo devices. Next is the listener to the Nest protect detectors. All in all, very pleased. Cellular monitoring with my prior system was $28 per month. Savings of $18 per month, so the payoff is pretty quick. 2 bars toAT&T should be plenty.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A. Olena

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I initially had technical difficulty setting the devices up due to the unclear instructions in the Ring app. The Ring customer service team called me and guided me to complete the setup flawlessly. They event sent me an extra range extender after I told them the battery is low. The devices are working well and the customer service is top-notch and very responsive. I wish they publicize their customer service phone and email in a readily visible spot on their website though.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Not designed to be the central component of a home security system. Do you have their doorbell?
customer_reviews.text: Decent basic home security option. However the monitored version lacks the ability to verify a real threat and call police. You have to pay more for that service. So monitoring isn’t robust. Better to purchase another self-monitored system, or investigate your local jurisdiction's requirements for monitored alarm systems to find out if there are savings here. Ring states that they are actively improving the system beyond what it is, so this may get much better. Wait and see. From a self monitored perspective, the ring does not integrate meaningfully using IFTTT. So while it has a few features, most of them are irrelevant, or meant to support a doorbell, rather than doorbell supports home security. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: G. E. Roquet

customer_reviews.title: System sucks
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY...I HAVE SPENT THE LAST 3 MONTHS 'FIXING' THIS SYSTEM OVER AND OVER AND OVER AND OVER AND OVER...YOU GET THE IDEA..I WOULD LIKE NOTHING MORE THAN TAKE THIS WHOLE #@%$&$# THING OUTSIDE AND TAKE A HAMMER TO IT!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought three floodlight packages that incorporated the free Alexa device. Range of motion detector capabilities far greater than expectations. Easy Install. Love the user friendly setup with app. Will buy further products for home. I recommend setting your motion sector range right away especially if you live in an high traffic area. Otherwise your notifications will be going off on a continuous basis. Great Product and have recommended to friends & family. This product is especially great for individuals that travel on a consistent basis for constant updates & constant visuals on home.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Bostwick

customer_reviews.title: Very good alarm system. Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: The system works very well, and easy to set up all parts. Siren is very loud even you can hear from the ouside of the house. The thing I very likes about ring is the back up system. You don't have to worry while running out of power or internet. The system still works even when you don't have power and internet. Ring also does NOT require a contract for the system to be able to work. Highly recommend to use ring alarm system
customer_reviews.author: Tam

customer_reviews.title: Contact Sensor and motion detector stopped workings
customer_reviews.text: Initially the set up was easy and seems to work. Then we started to get a motion sensor malfunction where it would detect motion when there was none. This unfortunately lead to the police coming when we were not home. Then the motion detector stopped working, hours on the phone with tech support, new batteries, worked for a month and stopped again. Then a contact sensor stopped working and resetting it with a new battery did not work. We have a ring doorbell and stick up cam we love. Alexa integration works. Keypad is great. if the sensors did not malfunction, fail, or the tech support was easier and resetting was easier it would be a great system.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff P

customer_reviews.title: Great alarm system, excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great alarm system, which will only get better after the development of the additional sensors such as glass break detectors and carbon monoxide and smoke detectors. One of the great attributes of this system is the low cost of the product and the low cost of professional monitoring at $10 per month! The system is very easy to install and set up, I have 13 door and entry sensor, and 2 motion detectors. It took a little over an hour to get everything mounted and synced with the base station. I have had the system for a couple of weeks now and have had no issues, love the fact my home is protected when we leave.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great alarm system!
customer_reviews.text: Works great in my small office. Easy set up. Had it operational since 3/19. Had one small hiccup, easily remedied by tech support. Easy for everyone in the office to use, and I assigned them their own personal codes so I can see who turns on and off the alarm via email. Cheap $100/year monitoring, smoke and carbon monoxide detection by easily adding the "First Alert 2-in-1 Z-Wave Wireless Smoke Detector & Carbon Monoxide Alarm". This system will pay for itself in less than one year because of the less expensive monitoring.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wade

customer_reviews.title: Decent hardware, terrible user interface
customer_reviews.text: Hardware isn't bad but the User Interface is the worst. You can only have one Main User so your spouse can't do things like turn the camera monitoring on and off. Also, you can't set the system to NOT set off the alarm in any scenario. No flexibility for the user. These are things that you don't find out off the bat. Also, you end up having to pay the monthly fee or your cameras are basically useless.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Tomczyk

customer_reviews.title: Problems in first few months! Sad!
customer_reviews.text: All-in-all, this was decently priced and easy to install and pair with component parts. However, figuring out the motion detector and notifications took some doing to set up. However, after less than two months, the door opening indicators started making static noises rather than chimes or beeps and after resetting the devices all sound indicators for any door or window alerts ceased completely. So now I have no “sound” indicator when any door or window is opened. So full functionality no longer exists. Maybe 2nd gen devices work better but I would probably steer clear of this version of the product no matter the price, unless partial functionality is what you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Robb

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worst customer service
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product installed at home for more than 7 months and Ring's customer service has not been able to help with the permit process, which I cannot initiate myself. On top of that the keypad just stopped working and the Ring support is not available. I absolute do not recommend to buy this product as you will end up without professional monitoring if you have to rely on Ring service. I have had other issues with other Ring products as well (motion sensor) and the general poor quality and reliability of Ring products makes any Ring product purchase a no-go. Do yourself a favor and buy higher quality products instead
customer_reviews.author: Thomas F.

customer_reviews.title: My ring doorbells are not compatable with this system.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a couple of ring doorbells, adding this system really slows down the motion detector and the doorbell ringing. When I do get an alert from the doorbells, whoever rang is already back in their vehicles. Even with a WiFi extender it’s very slow. I have to constantly go into my doorbell settings and set a doorbell ringtone and motion ringtone. It resets to silent by itself. This never happened before setting up this security system. My doorbells worked fine when I had ADT. I guess that is why monitoring cost is so cheap.
customer_reviews.author: JMAM

customer_reviews.title: Great system, affordable and functional!
customer_reviews.text: Multiple issues with the base station: connection failure, power loss, etc... sensors keep losing connection and have to be re-connected all over again. System is down most of the time when I try to access it remotely. Update: after consulting with a very attentive Ring customer support team and replacing a defective power supply, I’m happy to report that the system has been working like a charm. Thank you, Ring Team!
customer_reviews.author: Luis E.

customer_reviews.title: What are you waiting for?! Buy this now!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down! This is the best alarm system that money can buy. I used a SimpliSafe for 4 days before sending it back to them. I didn’t want a feature of having to hook it up with the police station. SimpliSafe forces you to pay monthly for features that this offers for FREE! Such as being able to arm/disarm from anywhere you have cellular service. When coupled with a Ring doorbell and an Alexa device the features and things you can do with the alarm are increased! Would buy this again and I recommend it to ALL of my friends and family!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good DIY alarm system
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install especially with Youtube videos. Everything works well. Understand the complaints of the motion detector once it senses motion does not sense it for a few more minutes. That is to preserve battery life. All you need for the motion detectors is to sense that initial motion to trigger it in my opinion. There seems a slight longer delay in notification to your app but that may be a little nit picky. Contact sensors work well. Signed up for the monthly monitoring and their response to a trigger of the alarm was good. Good pricing for professional monitoring if pay up for 12 months.
customer_reviews.author: WasabiKid

customer_reviews.title: It's awesome, just buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Finally a system that does it all at a reasonable price. This system down to every sensor is all customizable, with log files, power status, sounds, and more all through the simple Ring app. There is no delay between the Ring app base station as compared to ADT or Brinks. The system has a back up battery and cell phone via GSM, so if either the internet or power go out, you will get an alert through the app. (That's right Verizon you're being watch; cutting my internet for a few hours in the middle of the night!). I also recommend the Ring pro doorbell that integrates with Alexa Show.
customer_reviews.author: Billy T.

customer_reviews.title: Will break within 3 months! And will continue to do so!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this ring alarm system for 9 months now, and it has crashed/ broken on me over 3 times. The base station just completely stops working. No power will go into into it despite it being plugged in. You have to call in to the customer support line and have them reset it for it to start working again which is completely bizarre. If you're looking for a reliable security system THIS IS NOT IT.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for a few days. I give it five stars for ease of install and ease of use setting the alarm and disabling it and the price of the monitoring. I like the panic button feature for when the wife is alone. Only one thing I haven't figured out yet is how to turn off the chime every time a door or window is opened. If you can't turn it off when you want I'll have to adjust the rating to a four star. So far it has been working fine.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cooley

customer_reviews.title: It's definitely easy to install if you follow the instructions
customer_reviews.text: I have to give it to Ring - this system was very easy to install. Just follow the instructions and you will be in business in no time. The alarm is very loud and I recommend moving your pets out of the house before you set it off. Dogs will not like the noise. Don't ask me how I know this. All in all it's a very easy system to install and I think it is gong to do the job for my small home.
customer_reviews.author: Squanto McGee

customer_reviews.title: Ring system not easy to install
customer_reviews.text: There must have been 5 books of install manuals and the directions are terrible. System with 3 adults could not be installed. Terrible advertising. 2 sided tape has to come off to change batteries or re set device. TERRIBLE SYSTEM TO SET UP.
customer_reviews.author: Geradette Tschada

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Worst purchase I have ever brought what a waste of money alarm delay about fifteen minutes you can break in take what you want before alarm even goes off and the service only let you know when alarm is turned on or off doesn't alert police waste of money a piece of junk
customer_reviews.author: Pat M.

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer support
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to add hub etc to existing camera network. Install led to a whole new loop that wasn’t visible to paid monitoring. Can’t reconfigure ti monitored group because now product is “registered”. Called Ring ., they can’t or won’t even look in their system .. so i basically own a brick,
customer_reviews.author: Don D

customer_reviews.title: Great alarm  System to replace a 39 year old alarm
customer_reviews.text: Great produce. Easy to install. I had an existing 30 year old alarm. I purchased the RingRetrofit Kit to connect all my old windows and doors. Used the wiring in the walls from the old key pads to bring power up to to the Ring Key Pads. When finished it’s a professional looking and working alarm system. It would be 100 % perfect if we could control the Inside Ring Cameras to power up only when the alarm is set. I have added a GE Power Module to turn the cameras on and off. Would be nice to have the alarm do it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Mowry

customer_reviews.title: Great for apartment living
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for. I live in a smaller place and this kit had everything I needed to get started. I ordered an extra motion sensor for an additional room. It was so easy to set up and I was up and running in 15 minutes. I love the integration with the Alexa app for guard mode. It was also very easy to setup. Great product for a great price. I shopped for an national alarm company system and it was gonna cost almost $50 bucks a month. I hope they keep adding additional capabilities to this system cause there are so many great things it can do as a security hub.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: You can do this yourself
customer_reviews.text: I had a little trouble linking the base station to my phone's bluetooth connection but was able to make the connection after a few tries. Had the same issue with the WI-FI connection but was able to get through the setup relatively trouble free. I like the ability to control the system with either the app or with the keypad. I have an echo dot but have not connected it up yet. After setting it just up last night, I'm very happy with it so far. I plan to add the video doorbell and a few more door sensors and maybe some cameras later on. I can see why its so popular and I like it too.
customer_reviews.author: SCPistolero

customer_reviews.title: Check your smoke alarm brand before buying the bundle!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price, however note that the Smoke/CO Listener is designed for First Alert brand alarms and does not work with Kiddie brand.
customer_reviews.author: S Feeney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value. DIY install
customer_reviews.text: I'll be honest, the Ring doorbell was a huge PITA to install. Didn't have high hope for this one, but installation was smooth and painless. If you aren't mechanically handy, there are quick online videos on how to install the various pieces. About 30 seconds of a 1 minute video. Not some guy droning on and on in a 15 minute video on how to do it. Everything is battery backed and the system has an LTE standby if your wireless goes out. The price is right too, cheaper than the google system both for the gear and the monthly subscription for professional monitoring.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: [*BEWARE*] Poor Home Security System.
customer_reviews.text: Its a good concept, it seems so simple. Let me tell you, its not. First of all, the door sensor wouldn't work on my door. Second, some devices kept losing signal and some were showing low battery (range extender that was plugged in, it was a simple fix though, just unplug, and plug back in). Lastly the adhesive ripped my drywall off after i tried to take it off. Beware
customer_reviews.author: ZaidProductions

customer_reviews.title: Great System and Professional Monitoring at a GREAT price point.
customer_reviews.text: Easy set-up. App works GREAT. Cost effective $10 for professional monitoring. 7 day trial period, so the police don't show up at your door while you're trying to get used to turning the system off and on. Expandable. I feel like most, if not all, of the bad reviews are due to slow home internet and/or subpar wireless router or not following installation directions as the system has performed flawlessly so far with my setup.
customer_reviews.author: DerrickR

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Had this for almost a month now and would highly recommend this to anyone. Very simple setup. The app walks you through everything. Was so impressed with the app decided to go with the ring door bell for the front door and will continue to add cameras. The motion sensors work great. Have mine in large areas and covering rooms with multiple windows, they pick up all motion expected. Contact sensors are simple to stick wherever needed. Only compliant here is the screws they provide strip very easily, had to use my own screws. You will not be disappointed with the product or the features on there app.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Ring 👍🏽👍🏽👍🏽
customer_reviews.text: I really like how simple this system is. It's basic & does what you need to monitor your home. I've looked into other systems & they are either expensive or requires a subscription to be able to get any notification. Ring's best feature is to be able to receive notifications from the app of any activities you want it to notify you. It can be self-monitored without subscription. The only thing I wish it was able to do was send text notifications just in case you're in an area with bad internet reception on your phone. Other than that, it's a nice system & provides everything you need to self-monitor your home. Hopefully it'll last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: VOTE

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts!!!!
customer_reviews.text: When i got everything up and running i noticed i was missing half of the door sensor. Went to try and get help in someone sending me a new sensor they referred me to ring. Ring said that since i bought it through Amazon i would have to take it up with them. I really hope someone reads this and gets in touch with me so they will send me a door sensor kit. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

product_meta.title: Ring Alarm 5 Piece Kit (1st Gen) – Home Security System with optional 24/7 Professional Monitoring – No long-term contracts – Works with Alexa
feature_bullets: Ring Alarm puts whole-home security at your fingertips. Get alerts on your smart phone when doors or windows open or motion is detected.
Optional 24/7 professional monitoring is just $10/month. No long-term contracts or cancellation fees.
Manage Ring Alarm and other Ring products—including Ring Doorbell—with the Ring app.
Customize Ring Alarm for your needs. Add components at any time for whole home protection.
Easily setup Ring Alarm in minutes—without tools or professional installation.
The 5 piece kit includes a base station, contact sensor, motion detector, keypad, and range extender.
Works with Alexa to arm, disarm, and check the status of your Ring Alarm security system with your voice.
